greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Regular triangle read by rows: T(n, k) gives the number of times that the denominator of sigma(x,-1) (A017666) is equal to k when x goes from 1 to n.
comment: The sum of terms of the n-th row is n.
T(n, n) = 1 when n is in A014567.
T(n, n) = 0 when n is in A069059.
T(n, 1) increases when n is a multiperfect number A007691.
For a given k, the first index n for which T(n,k) = 1 is A162657(k).
link: Michel Marcus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5050
example: The first 6 terms of A017666 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 1 where 1 appears twice, 2 to 5 appear once and 6 is absent; giving the 6th row: 2, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0.
mathematica: Table[Length@ Select[Range@ n, Denominator[DivisorSigma[-1, #]] == k &], {n, 13}, {k, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 22 2015 *)
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {vds = vector(nn, n, denominator(sigma(n,-1))); for (n=1, nn, vin = vector(n, k, vds[k]); rown = vector(n, k, #select(x->x==k, vin)); for(k=1, n, print1(rown[k], ", ")); print(););}
results.author: _Michel Marcus_, Sep 22 2015
